name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

strengths: 70 HP is excellent for a Basic Pokemon
Free retreat cost provides maximum mobility
Slash uses only Colorless energy - fits any deck
Swords Dance + Slash combo can deal 60 damage
With DCE, can attack turn 2 reliably
weaknesses: Fire weakness is problematic against Fire decks
Base 30 damage on Slash is low without Swords Dance setup
Swords Dance setup telegraphs your next move
Grass typing provides no offensive advantage in Base-Jungle meta
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - powers Slash instantly
Plus Power - turn 2 Swords Dance + Slash + PlusPower = 70 damage KO
Scoop Up - reset after Swords Dance if needed
Any deck - Colorless energy requirements make it universally splashable
counters: Magmar - Fire type with Smokescreen disruption
Mr. Mime - Invisible Wall blocks both 30 and 60 damage Slash

competitiveHistory: Scyther from Jungle is widely considered one of the best cards from the original sets and a defining card of the Base Set era. It became an instant staple in the Haymaker archetype, replacing Farfetch'd as the third member of the Hitmonchan/Electabuzz core. Scyther's combination of 70 HP, free retreat, Fighting resistance (which countered Hitmonchan mirrors), and Colorless energy costs made it the most splashable and versatile Basic Pokemon available. The Swords Dance + Double Colorless Energy + Plus Power combo could achieve turn 2 knockouts on most Pokemon. Scyther was so powerful that it was included in virtually every competitive deck regardless of type focus, and it remained a format staple until rotation. Many veteran players consider it the best Pokemon in the game's first three sets.

rulings.ruling: Swords Dance's effect lasts until the end of your next turn, regardless of whether Scyther attacks or is benched.
If Scyther uses Swords Dance and is then benched, the Swords Dance bonus is lost. The effect only applies while Scyther remains Active.
Swords Dance's bonus only applies to the Slash attack, not to damage from other sources or copied attacks.
The Swords Dance bonus is applied before Weakness and Resistance. So Slash would do 60 base, then doubled to 120 against Fire-weak Pokemon.
If Scyther is affected by Amnesia (making it forget Slash), the Swords Dance bonus cannot be used.
